name: Match the TV Plots - Over 20 Season-Long Shows Online Trivia | Television | 15 Questions

questions.text: A time-travelling alien (who often visits Earth) picks up companions along the way as he goes about in his time machine that is shaped like a 1960's-era British police call box.
questions.explanation:
Doctor Who.

	With seven actors who played the main character, the plot device was added that when a Time Lord was about to die, he could regenerate (up to 12 times), looking and acting quite a bit different. (1963-1989) "Doctor Who" has been revived in a second series, begun in 2005.  It has continued with the continuity of the original series, with the ninth, tenth, and eleventh Doctors, portrayed by Christopher Eccleston, David Tennant, and Matt Smith.  (The eighth Doctor, played by Paul McGann, was only portrayed on-screen in the 1996 made-for-TV movie.)

questions.text: The original name of 'The Ed Sullivan Show'.
questions.explanation:
Toast of the Town.

	It was renamed in 1955. The show ran from 1948 to 1971.

questions.text: This show started as nightly updates of the Iran Hostage Crisis.
questions.explanation:
ABC News Nightline.

	It began in 1980.

questions.text: The exploits of a US Marshall trying to keep the peace in the wild west town of Dodge City.
questions.explanation:
Gunsmoke.

	It starred James Arness, brother of Peter Graves, and ran from 1955 - 1975.

questions.text: This morning news and information show, which went on the air in 1952, had hosts such as Meredith Vieira and Matt Lauer.
Who of the following was not an anchor of the 'CBS Evening News' (which first aired in 1962)?
questions.explanation:
Peter Jennings.

	Walter Cronkite anchored from 1962 to 1981. Dan Rather has been at the desk from 1981 to 2005.  Bob Schieffer took over in 2005 for a year.  Katie Couric began in 2006.

questions.text: The soap opera, set in the town of Salem, starts with the narration 'Like sands through the hourglass...'
questions.explanation:
Days of Our Lives.

	This began airing in 1965. It's also the soap opera that Joey Tribbiani (Matt LeBlanc) twice had a part in on the show 'Friends'.

questions.text: This news and expose show began in 1968. Its 'theme music' is the ticking of a stopwatch.
Finish this quote from the opening narration of 'ABC's Wide World of Sports' (1961): 'The thrill of victory... and ______ ______.'
questions.correct: The agony of defeat & agony of defeat
questions.explanation:
The agony of defeat & agony of defeat.

	This phrase was notably followed by a ski jumper crashing just before takeoff and tumbling out of control. If I recall correctly, this skier was a east European who didn't know his fall had become such an icon of American sports TV until years later.

questions.text: This sketch comedy series has launched dozens of careers: Chevy Chase, Dana Carvey, Phil Hartman, and Julie Louis-Dreyfus, amongst others.
questions.explanation:
Saturday Night Live.

	This began airing in 1975.

questions.text: Back to sports: this seasonal show started when one football game a week was scheduled on Monday night.
questions.explanation:
N.F.L. Monday Night Football

	ABC began airing MNF in 1970. When ABC got the rights to the occasional game on Thursday night, the name of the show wasn't 'Thursday Night Football', but 'Monday Night Football, Thursday Edition'. MNF aired on ABC until 2005.  Starting in the 2006 season, it began airing on ESPN.

questions.text: This soap opera, set in Pine Valley, starred Susan Lucci from its first episode aired in 1970.
questions.explanation:
All My Children.

	Ms. Lucci was nominated 19 times for a Daytime Emmy Award (from 1978 to 1999, almost yearly) before she finally did win one in 1999.

questions.text: This soap began production in 1956 on CBS.
questions.explanation:
As The World Turns.

	'Another World' was supposed to be a spin-off of 'As The World Turns', but it got picked up by NBC. CBS therefore did not allow any stars to cross-over their roles. But after 'AW' was cancelled (after 35 years), several characters from 'AW' appeared on 'ATWT'.

questions.text: This man was the king of late-night television. He hosted his stint of 'The Tonight Show' for 30 years.
questions.explanation:
Johnny Carson & Carson & Johnny.

	Johnny passed away in 2005 from smoking-related causes.

questions.text: This soap, set in Port Charles, NY, is noted for the romance plot between characters Luke and Laura.
